alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Dripping Springs; Northwest Pinal County; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Superior (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 4:09PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gila, Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 500 PM MST... At 408 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Florence, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Florence, Superior, Hayden, Christmas, Florence Junction, Queen Valley, Boyce Thompson Arboretum and Top-Of-The-World. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 210 and 239. AZ Route 77 between mile markers 135 and 139, and between mile markers 146 and 166. AZ Route 79 between mile markers 129 and 150. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Dripping Springs; Northwest Pinal County; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Superior
